title: Bo Nix keeps passing every test
content: How did Broncos coach Sean Payton know Nix was the real deal? A finely tuned QB evaluation process told him, as detailed in the book "American Kings: A Biography of the Quarterback."

title: Vikings WR Addison suspended for first 3 games
content: Vikings wide receiver Jordan Addison has been suspended for the first three games of the NFL season for violating the league's substances of abuse policy.

title: Buccaneers bring aboard veteran QB Bridgewater
content: Veteran NFL QB Teddy Bridgewater has signed on with the Bucs after flying to Tampa to meet with team officials and undergo a physical on Tuesday.

title: Rams RB Williams signs 3-year, $33M extension
content: RB Kyren Williams, who had the NFL's highest touch rate last season, signed a 3-year, $33 million contract extension with the L.A. Rams with $23 million guaranteed.

title: Ex-NFL RB convicted for role in dogfighting outfit
content: LeShon Johnson -- who played for the Packers, Cardinals and Giants -- faces five years in prison after being convicted for his role in an Oklahoma dogfighting operation.

title: Jets, Fields preach patience amid camp struggles
content: New Jets quarterback Justin Fields and coach Aaron Glenn said they're not yet concerned about New York's struggles on offense in training camp.

title: Storm acquire Sykes from Mystics for Clark, pick
content: The Mystics have traded Brittney Sykes to the Seattle Storm in a deal that sends Alysha Clark and a 2026 first-round pick to D.C.

title: Phils' Alvarado, nearing end of ban, apologizes
content: Phillies reliever Jose Alvarado, who is nearing completion of his 80-game ban for violating MLB's drug policy, apologized to teammates and fans for his "mistake."

title: Masters hospitality packages to run up to $219K
content: A new "Official Masters Hospitality" program will be offering packages that can run upward of $219,600 for the week of the tournament.

title: The 40 most important players in college football this season
content: From QBs on surefire CFP contenders to potential stars looking to break through, these players will shape the 2025 season.

title: 'He never wanted to leave': How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Team that cooked, most frustrated fan bases and more: Passan's trade deadline awards
content: What we learned from the deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: Latest buzz from NFL training camp: What we heard at 16 teams' practices, plus fantasy intel
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: Saints QB1 or not, Tyler Shough believes 'this is going to work out'
content: Expectations are high for the second-round pick, but the 26-year-old knows adversity and he's not backing away.

title: Confidence, conditioning and catches: What we've learned about Travis Hunter so far
content: The Jaguars' dual receiver and cornerback has had an eventful two weeks in his first NFL training camp.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with star injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without their stars.

title: WNBA trade grades: Report cards for every major deal
content: Adding Brittney Sykes gives Seattle the WNBA's most versatile perimeter trio ahead of the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Are high-priced foreign players really ready for the jump to the Premier League?
content: Digging into why the Premier League is so much more challenging for players than any other league in the world.

title: Man United passed their preseason tests. Now comes the real challenge
content: It's going to take more than good vibes to get Man United back into the top half of the Premier League table.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Watkins linked with Man United amid Sesko pursuit
content: Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins could head to Manchester United, in the event that a move for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25 rankings: Every team's most important nonconference game
content: Regional rivalries, freshmen debuts and more of the most intriguing nonconference game to tune into for each preseason top 25 team.

title: Mock draft: QBs selected with five of first eight picks of 12-team PPR superflex
content: As expected, quarterbacks were popular early on, which meant some quality wide receivers and players with upside were available in the middle rounds.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts.

title: Pickups: Seven players seizing post-deadline opportunity
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including De'Aaron Fox, Spurs max extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Can Barça's title defense endure summer of self sabotage?
content: It's been one misstep after another for Barcelona, but on the field they're so strong it may not matter.

title: Missed wages, closed stand, quitting players: Why Sheffield Wednesday could go bust
content: Sheffield Wednesday are one of the most historically important clubs in England, but they could cease to exist.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 QBs in Madden NFL 26
content: From Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson to Jayden Daniels, here are the top 10 quarterbacks in Madden NFL 26

title: Gaza Civil Defence Says Israeli Attacks Kill 68 In 24 Hours
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said 68 people were killed by Israeli gunfire and air strikes on Tuesday, including 56 who were waiting near aid distribution sites inside the Palestinian territory.

title: India, Russia Reaffirm Commitment To Enhance Defence Ties Amid Trump Threat
content: India and Russia on Tuesday reaffirmed their commitment to boost bilateral defence cooperation during a meeting between Indian Ambassador Vinay Kumar and Russia's Deputy Defence Minister Colonel-General Alexander Fomin.

title: No Caste Discrimination In Water Distribution: Madras High Court's Big Order
content: In a powerful and far-reaching order, the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has condemned caste-based discrimination in access to public water resources and directed statewide implementation of equitable practices.

title: CRPF Woman Claims Police Inaction After Burglary In House In Tamil Nadu
content: A video of a woman personnel of CRPF in uniform alleging police inaction over a burglary at her family home in Vellore has gone viral, sparking debate over crime response and law enforcement accountability in Tamil Nadu.

title: 13-Year-Old Boy Dies After Being Hit By Speeding Truck In UP: Cops
content: A 13-year-old boy died after being hit by a speeding truck in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi district on Tuesday, police said.

title: In Conservation Win, Tamil Nadu State Animal Nilgiri Tahr's Numbers Shoot Up
content: In a major conservation success story, the endangered Nilgiri Tahr - Tamil Nadu's state animal - has shown a significant rise in numbers.

title: Trump Says Tariffs On Pharma, Chips Coming By "Next Week Or So"
content: US President Donald Trump signaled Tuesday that fresh tariffs on imported pharmaceuticals and semiconductors could be unveiled as soon as the coming week, as he presses on in efforts to reshape global trade.

title: US Should Not Burn Relationship With "Strong Ally Like India": Nikki Haley
content: US should not burn its relationship with a "strong ally like India" and give a pass to China, Nikki Haley said on Tuesday, amid President Donald Trump's attacks against New Delhi over tariffs and purchases of Russian oil.

title: Ajit Doval In Moscow Amid US Tariff Threat Over India's Russian Oil Imports
content: Amid stiffening ties between US and India over Russian oil imports, National Security Adviser Ajit Doval arrived in Moscow for a visit aimed at strengthening ties between Russia and India.

title: Fake Residential Certificate Application In Trump's Name Surfaces In Bihar
content: In a bizarre twist to the growing trend of fake residence certificate cases in Bihar, an application has surfaced in Samastipur district seeking a certificate in the name of US President Donald Trump.

title: Video: Standing On White House Roof, Trump Jokes About Installing Missiles
content: Donald Trump made an unexpected appearance Tuesday on a White House rooftop and joked about installing nuclear missiles at a time of escalating tensions with Russia.

title: More Acquittals, Fewer Convictions: 5 Years Of Madhya Pradesh's Anti-Conversion Law
content: The first five and a half years of Madhya Pradesh's stringent anti-religious conversion law branded in political circles as the 'Love Jihad' law paint a picture far removed from its stated intent.

title: Uttarakhand Cloudburst Highlights: Many Likely Missing In Uttarkashi's Dharali, Red Alert Till Tomorrow
content: Uttarakhand Flash Floods Highlights: Horrifying visuals of the incident showed a strong stream of water flowing down from a hill towards the Dharali village, sweeping away many houses.

title: Pak-Linked Ghost SIM Card Racket Busted in Assam's Bilasipara, 1 Arrested
content: In a major crackdown on cybercrime, one person who was allegedly involved in a fake SIM card racket with suspected links to Pakistan was arrested in Assam's Bilasipara today.

title: 'Kuki-Zo Council Not Legitimate, Can't Operate In Our Areas': Zomi Council
content: A Zomi tribes' organisation in Manipur's Churachandpur has told the recently formed Kuki-Zo Council (KZC) not to operate in areas where the Zomi tribes are in majority.

title: Parliament Extends President's Rule In Manipur By 6 Months
content: Parliament on Tuesday approved a statutory resolution to extend President's Rule in Manipur for another six months beyond August 13.

title: Have To Be Ready To Respond To Any "Acts Of Violence" By Pak: Defence Chief
content: Indian military will have to be prepared to respond to "any acts of violence by Pakistan", both by state and non-state actors, and those in the armed forces should understand this "new norm", Chief of Defence Staff Gen Chauhan said on Tuesday.

title: 'Want To Celebrate It Like Eid': Yunus After Announcing Elections In February
content: A year after former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was toppled from power and left the country, Bangladesh has announced national elections.

title: Sunjay Kapur's Death Being Treated As "Non-Suspicious": UK Police
content: The British police on Tuesday said that the death of industrialist Sunjay Kapur at a polo club in Surrey is being treated as "non-suspicious".

title: ChatGPT Quoted In Delhi Assembly As Debate Erupts Over 'Hanging House' Claim
content: A routine day of proceedings in the Delhi Vidhan Sabha on Tuesday turned into a charged discussion over a controversial historical claim, with an unexpected participant entering the fray: ChatGPT.

title: House of Muthulakshmi Reddy, India’s first woman medicine graduate, in a dilapidated state
content: Sources in Avvai Home and Adyar Cancer Institute express willingness to renovate the building; Minister P.K. Sekarbabu promises to inspect the site soon and put the facility to good use

title: Chikungunya cases surge in Telangana; Centre and State report contradictory figures
content: The number presented in the Lok Sabha is wrong; we don’t know how that data was generated, but it is not consistent with our records, says Telangana Health officer

title: Hyderabad’s drain game fails: Collapsed vents suspected in Ameerpet deluge
content: Monday’s downpour exposed gaping holes, from collapsed vents and choked drains to under-capacity holding tanks, leaving key roads in Hyderabad inundated

title: Built-over lakes return to haunt prime areas of Hyderabad
content: In a span of two hours, with nearly 10 centimetres of rain lashing central parts of the city, stormwater rose through the old drainage routes

title: Manifold increase in rabies deaths in two years: Centre
content: In 2024, the highest number of rabies deaths was reported from Tamil Nadu (43), followed by Karnataka (42) and Andhra Pradesh (39). In 2023, 121 people died of rabies and 2,223 presumptive cases were reported

title: Do not summon petitioner to police station: High Court
content: Vadhtya Ramulu alleged that Maheshwaram police were harassing him since he sought a probe into purchase of Bhoodan lands by some IAS and IPS officers

title: Venugopal seeks closure of case against nuns held in Chhattisgarh
content: Congress leader writes to Home Minister and Chhattisgarh CM; demands action against Bajrang Dal members

title: Construction of Common Central Secretariat buildings to be over in 22 months: Khattar
content: Several ministries housed in Shastri Bhavan, Krishi Bhavan, Nirman Bhavan and Udyog Bhavan in the national capital will soon shift to new locations on Kasturba Gandhi Marg, Minto Road, and Netaji Palace temporarily for two years

title: ‘Kaiga units operated continuously for over 500 days on eight occasions’
content: The four units of KGS have operated continuously for over 500 days on eight occasions and over 365 days on 19 occasions, thus setting benchmark parameters for the operating stations of Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited

title: Kolhapur elephant row: Maharashtra government to file a review petition in SC over animal’s transfer to Vantara
content: Chief Minister Fadnavis says a special team will be formed to care for elephant Madhuri after her return from the rescue/rehabilitation centre

title: PMK senior leaders believe voters, and not office-bearers, will decide the party leadership
content: Both factions have started talking with other parties to ensure that they remain in pole position. While Dr. Anbumani has embarked on a padayatra, focusing on the PMK strongholds and presenting himself as the face of the party, Dr. Ramadoss, 86, is headlining a women’s conference at Poompuhar on August 10

title: UPSC plans to send recruitment alerts to institutions via email
content: The UPSC Chairman said that “posts remained vacant or became infructuous during the interview stage as suitable candidates are not found by the interview board”

title: Army says no ceasefire violation along LoC
content: “There have been some media and social media reports regarding ceasefire violation in Poonch region. It is clarified that there has been no ceasefire violation along the LoC. Please avoid spreading unverified information,” the Army said in a statement.

title: Two-day seminar in State capital to focus on tribal life and knowledge
content: Workshop brings together activists, scholars, artists, ethnic food experts, tribal healers, and community representatives from Kerala and beyond. It aims at providing a comprehensive understanding of tribal life, with a focus on cultural, ecological, and socio-political dimensions

title: Caste killing: investigation will be completed in 60 days, Tamil Nadu government informs High Court
content: An interim compensation of ₹6 lakh has already been handed over to the family. A case has been booked under the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act. No offender will be allowed to go scot free, says the government

title: Go beyond politics to work towards improving city’s infrastructure, urges Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The Union Minister said rail connectivity within the city and to the city from outside will be doubled in the next three years

title: Madras High Court orders disciplinary action against five IPS officers for dereliction of duty
content: Justice P. Velmurugan also orders initiation of departmental action against 11 Inspectors who had served at Kullanchavadi police station in Cuddalore district since 2015

title: Amaravati hackathon to promote culture of innovation and problem-solving
content: Registration for the event started and August 12 is the last day for submission of ideas by college teams on AQVH 2025 portal

title: Allahabad High Court judge Prashant Kumar ‘cut a sorry figure for himself, made mockery of justice’: Supreme Court
content: The apex court reprimands Justice Prashant Kumar, says he found nothing wrong in a litigant filing a criminal case against a buyer in a purely civil dispute over an unpaid balance of money in a sale transaction

title: BDA gets approval to form six new layouts along PRR-2
content: Apart from planned development along the new road, these layouts are also being taken up to compensate land losers to the road project with developed land along the road.

title: Karnataka High Court directs State government to submit Commission report on Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede
content: We also organised RCB team’s facilitation on the steps of Vidhana Soudha upon Government’s request, DNA Networks tells Court

title: Two women dead, three injured in fall at religious gathering in Madhya Pradesh’s Sehore
content: Police attribute incident to crowding at Kubereshwar Dham during Rudraksha distribution; no stampede reported

title: Non-lowering of national flag after sunset in itself is not an offence, says Kerala HC
content: Court quashes criminal proceedings against Secretary of Angamaly municipality for allegedly not lowering the flag at the municipal office for almost two days after Independence Day in 2015

title: Internal quota: panel proposes 6% for Dalit left, 5% for Dalit right
content: H.N. Nagamohan Das panel is learnt to have created a separate group for Adi Karnataka, Adi Dravida and Adi Andhra, providing 1% reservation for the three

title: On eve of global plastic talks, DMK MP pushes India to take ‘lead role’
content: The meeting should make way for legally binding obligations that span the entire life cycle of plastics, Thamizhachi Thangapandian suggests in her letter to the Environment Minister

title: Urea ‘smuggling’: BJP demands probe and White Paper on supply situation
content: ‘The shocking seizure of urea being smuggled from Karnataka to Kerala is not just illegal; it is also a direct betrayal of Karnataka’s farmers’

title: Bengaluru largely unfazed as RTC strike disrupts bus services across Karnataka
content: As of 6 p.m., the overall operational rate of four corporations across the State stood at 71.9%, with major variations in performance among the four State-run transport corporations

title: Amid tariff row, Army shares 1971 newspaper clipping highlighting U.S. arms supply to Pakistan
content: Article published on August 5, 1971 quotes a Minister telling Parliament that the U.S. had shipped arms worth $2 billion to Pakistan since 1954, adding that the U.S. and China supplied Pakistan with arms at concessional rates

title: ED attaches assets in cyberfraud case
content: Properties linked to U.S.-arrested accused Chirag Tomar, his family and entities traced to cyber fraud

title: Congress leaders in New Delhi to expedite reorganisation process
content: KPCC president Sunny Joseph, Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan, and United Democratic Front convener Adoor Prakash hold marathon meetings with MPs, reportedly to ease purported intra-party tensions over recasting district congress committees

title: If Stalin has given good administration, then why hold outreach programmes: Palaniswami
content: The former Chief Minister lashes out at the DMK government for closing down 2,000 pro-poor ‘Amma Mini Clinics’ and discontinuing distribution of laptops to schoolchildren

title: Transport workers’ stir triggers political slugfest between CM and LoP in Karnataka
content: While Ashok blamed Siddaramaiah for the staff going on a strike, the latter shot back saying that it was when Mr. Ashok was the Transport Minister that the transport staff had gone on a 15-day strike as they were not being paid their salaries fully then

title: Man sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for setting nephew ablaze
content: George Titus of Kulathoor falsely accused the then Class VI student of stealing money from a neighbour, poured kerosene on him and set him on fire

title: Thoothukudi Basilica’s 11-day annual feast concludes with a grand car procession
content: On Monday, Thoothukudi Bishop Most Rev. Stephen Antony led the vespers, the special evening prayers, and the feast mass on Tuesday after a series of Holy Masses since 4.30 a.m.

title: Shibu Soren cremated at native village Nemra
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge and party leader Rahul Gandhi also reached his village to attend the funeral of the veteran tribal leader

title: Officials told to speed-up land acquisition for Polavaram R&R, NH projects
content: The Collector emphasises that Gram Sabhas must be held in all concerned villages after identifying land parcels, says officials, including RDOs and DSPs, should participate and engage with farmers transparently during these public hearings

title: Loans at 4% interest rate for women to promote entrepreneurship in tourism sector in Kerala
content: Enterprises registered under the women-friendly scheme of the Responsible Tourism Mission to be eligible

title: New study by IISc researchers reveals how reward modulates attention in humans
content: The experiment examines how the expectation of a reward modulates the two key components of attention: sensitivity and bias

title: T.N. Minister lays foundation stone for restoration of 128-year-old Collectorate building in Cuddalore
content: Spread over 44,960 sq.feet, the 128-year-old red brick structure has suffered damage due to ageing, particularly the Madras tile roofing and the walls. A preliminary assessment revealed that the building’s condition was stable

title: Construction of KGS Units 5, 6  picks pace; first pour of concrete to commence by November
content: The project cost of ₹21,000 crore for the two units will be released over a period of five years, says Kaiga Site Director B. Vinod Kumar

title: 'Right to choose': Russia backs India, rebukes Trump's tariff threat over crude oil
content: The Kremlin has defended India's right to choose its trading partners, criticizing Trump's threat to raise tariffs over Russian oil imports. India has rebuffed Trump's warning as "unjustified," asserting its oil purchases are driven by market conditions. India vowed to protect its interests, noting that the US and EU also trade with Russia.

title: Eye on Beijing, Delhi & Manila unite in strategic partnership
content: India and the Philippines have elevated their relationship to a strategic partnership, emphasizing expanded cooperation in defence, security, and maritime domains. This development includes finalizing terms for joint military exercises and India's support for freedom of navigation in the Indo-Pacific. Both nations voiced concerns over China's actions in the South China Sea, reaffirming the importance of the 2016 arbitral award.

title: Long-range precision hits had psychological impact on Pakistan: CDS
content: General Anil Chauhan stated that Operation Sindoor, involving long-range precision strikes during cross-border hostilities in May, had a significant psychological impact on Pakistan. He emphasized that the operation, which is still ongoing, aimed to achieve political goals through targeted action rather than territorial gains.

title: SC grants Rs 4cr Mumbai flat as alimony, rejects Rs 12cr & BMW demand
content: The Supreme Court, employing its Article 142 powers, dissolved a marriage by directing the husband to gift his wife a Rs 4 crore Mumbai flat. The court rejected the wife's demand for an additional Rs 12 crore and a BMW, deeming the flat sufficient alimony given her education and potential for self-support, while also considering the husband's current unemployment.

title: UP fine with Banke Bihari panel headed by ex-judge but says he must be 'Sanatani Hindu'
content: The Uttar Pradesh government has agreed to the Supreme Court's proposal to form an interim committee, headed by a retired High Court judge, to manage the Banke Bihari temple. This is pending the Allahabad HC's decision on the ordinance regarding the temple's takeover for development. The state proposes a committee composition, while Goswamis object, claiming hereditary control.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing Meta's $1 Bn job offer; CEO Zuckerberg launched...
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: Gaya’s GAY airport code sparks unease but can’t be altered
content: The Indian government has declined a request to change Gaya International Airport's code 'GAY', citing International Air Transport Association (IATA) protocols. The aviation minister stated that codes are only altered if they pose a safety risk, and 'GAY' was assigned based on the airport's location name.

title: ED quizzes Anil Ambani for 8 hours in laundering case
content: Anil Ambani faced extensive questioning by the Enforcement Directorate regarding foreign assets and financial transactions linked to his group entities. The investigation centers on alleged money laundering, round-tripping of funds, and related-party transactions, particularly involving Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Home Finance. Ambani has requested additional time to provide necessary financial details.

title: 370 abrogation anniversary: ‘New J&K’ for LG; ‘Black Day’ for others
content: The sixth anniversary of Article 370's abrogation saw contrasting reactions in Jammu and Kashmir. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha hailed it as the dawn of a new era, emphasizing improved security and justice for terror victims' families.

title: Trump to announce new tariff plan for chips next week, says: We want them to ...
content: Donald Trump plans to impose new tariffs on semiconductor and chip imports to boost US manufacturing. This follows a Commerce Department investigation into the semiconductor market. While smartphones and computers were previously excluded from higher tariffs, these new measures aim to incentivize domestic production.

title: Climate change or Himalayan curse? What led to Uttarakhand cloudbursts
content: A cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district triggered flash floods, causing significant damage in high-altitude villages. The India Meteorological Department defines a cloudburst as rainfall exceeding 100 millimetres per hour. Research indicates Uttarakhand is highly prone to such events due to its altitude and climate change, necessitating stronger policy responses and better planning.

title: Dwyane Wade on LeBron James snubbing Bulls: Derrick Rose failed pitch; 2010 saga revisited
content: NBA legend Dwyane Wade revealed LeBron James' 2010 decision to decline the Chicago Bulls' offer. Wade, contemplating a return to his hometown team, was surprised by a call from James. The call revealed Miami Heat's plan to acquire three stars. Wade admitted he hadn't considered playing with James, relishing their rivalry.

title: Laptop on lap, phone in pocket? Study flags risk to sperm count
content: A new study by Calcutta University and the Institute of Reproductive Medicine suggests a link between prolonged mobile phone and laptop use and male infertility. The research, involving 1,200 men, found that radiation exposure, especially among those with specific genetic mutations, significantly increases the risk of azoospermia, challenging previous studies that dismissed such connections.

title: Palantir CEO says college degrees don’t matter: ‘We are asking people to…’
content: Palantir CEO Alex Karp stated that college degrees hold little significance at the company, emphasizing that employee value is determined by skills and performance. Karp highlighted that individuals without degrees often contribute substantial value, sometimes exceeding that of degree holders.

title: PSUs shouldn't behave like Shylock to become money-minded: SC
content: The Supreme Court criticized Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited (GUVNL) for prioritizing commercial interests over its role as a model public sector entity. The court rejected GUVNL's attempt to enforce a fixed tariff rate on wind power producers, emphasizing the government's renewable energy promotion policies. GUVNL's conduct was deemed unfair and likened to that of a 'Shylock'.

title: 'Will not call Trump': Brazil's Lula refuses to contact US prez; 50% tariffs remain unresolved
content: President Lula da Silva refuses to call Donald Trump amid escalating tensions over tariffs and sanctions. The US imposed a 50% tariff on Brazilian imports, while also sanctioning a Brazilian Supreme Court Justice. Brazil rejects US claims of political persecution, asserting judicial independence, as diplomatic efforts to ease the rift struggle to gain traction in Washington.

title: Sachin Tendulkar on what made Shubman Gill unstoppable
content: Sachin Tendulkar lauded Shubman Gill's record-breaking performance against England, highlighting his composure and respect for good deliveries. Tendulkar also praised Mohammed Siraj's relentless attitude and Ravindra Jadeja's underrated contributions. He further commended Yashasvi Jaiswal's fearless approach and KL Rahul's disciplined batting. Tendulkar advised against excessive scrutiny of Rishabh Pant's shot selection, acknowledging his impactful innings.

title: Trinity Rodman shines: Magic Johnson praises Dennis Rodman’s daughter
content: Trinity Rodman marked her return from injury with a stunning game-winning goal for the Washington Spirit against the Portland Thorns, electrifying fans and earning praise from part-owner Magic Johnson. Despite a strained relationship with her father, Dennis Rodman, Trinity continues to excel, showcasing her talent and resilience on the field, adding to her impressive list of achievements.

title: Russell Wilson skips Ciara, opts for sons-only brunch — gets booed at WWE SummerSlam
content: New York Giants quarterback Russell Wilson, enjoying a rare day off, spent quality time with his sons, Future and Win, starting with a heartwarming brunch. The trio then attended WWE SummerSlam at MetLife Stadium, where Wilson received a custom Giants-themed wrestling belt. Despite the warm welcome, the crowd unexpectedly booed Wilson when he appeared on the jumbotron.

title: Hulk Hogan snubbed grandkids: Brooke’s husband speaks out — ‘no interest’
content: Just days before his death at 71 from cardiac arrest, WWE icon Hulk Hogan reportedly reconciled with his estranged daughter, Brooke. A tearful conversation led to forgiveness, with both expressing their love and regrets. Despite this reconciliation, Brooke was reportedly not planning to attend her father's funeral. Hogan was also battling chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

title: UK coroner confirms Sunjay Kapur died ‘natural death’, police say death ‘non-suspicious’
content: Industrialist Sunjay Kapur's death, chairman of Sona Comstar, was due to natural causes, the Surrey coroner ruled, dismissing his mother's claims of foul play. Kapur, a US citizen, died from heart disease, confirmed by a post-mortem. Surrey police deemed the death non-suspicious, despite Rani Kapur's letter demanding investigation into a potential conspiracy.

title: Pakistan political standoff deepens as PTI marks Imran’s two years in jail
content: Pakistan faces a critical political deadlock as Imran Khan's PTI marks his two-year imprisonment with nationwide protests against the military establishment. Demonstrations demanding Khan's release have been met with government crackdowns, including arrests and convictions of PTI members.

title: 'India not good trading partner': Trump says will raise tariffs substantially in 24 hrs
content: US Presdient Donald Trump has declared his intention to significantly increase tariffs on India, citing country's purchase of Russian oil. He accuses India of profiting by reselling Russian oil while disregarding the conflict in Ukraine.

title: ‘Statehood must be restored’: Omar Abdullah writes to 42 parties
content: Omar Abdullah has urged 42 political parties, including the Congress, to advocate for the restoration of statehood to Jammu and Kashmir during the current Parliament session. He argues that downgrading a state to a Union Territory sets a dangerous precedent, emphasizing the need to uphold the constitutional rights and democratic values for the people of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: 'Over the last two months ... ': Gambhir opens up on Shubman Gill
content: Gautam Gambhir praised Shubman Gill's leadership and batting performance in the Test series against England, where Gill scored 754 runs with four centuries. Gambhir highlighted the team's collective effort and the outstanding performances of players like Mohammed Siraj, emphasizing the contributions of the entire squad to the series draw.

title: Is chewing food linked with a long and healthy life?
content: Chewing food thoroughly is crucial for digestion, nutrient absorption, and overall health. While the ideal number of chews varies, aiming for 20-30 times per bite is generally recommended. Proper chewing reduces digestive discomfort, aids weight control, and may even improve blood sugar levels in individuals with Type 2 diabetes.

title: 'Before Ramadan': Yunus announces Feb 2026 Bangladesh elections
content: Interim Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus announced Bangladesh's general elections will be held in February 2026, following consultations with political parties. The announcement coincided with the release of the "July Declaration," outlining proposed reforms and criticizing the previous administration. While celebrations marked the anniversary of Sheikh Hasina's ouster, Human Rights Watch raised concerns about the interim government's human rights record.

title: Donald Trump says JPMorgan, Bank of America rejected him as a customer
content: US President Donald Trump revealed that JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America have in the past refused him as a client, forcing him to use smaller banks. Trump stated JPMorgan Chase gave him a 20-day notice to move "hundreds of millions of dollars," and Bank of America subsequently declined his attempt to deposit over a billion dollars.

title: Jasprit Bumrah's 'what's next' post keeps fans wondering
content: India and England concluded a captivating Test series with a 2-2 draw. The final match saw India secure a narrow six-run victory at The Oval. Shubman Gill led the team, while Mohammed Siraj topped the bowling charts. Jasprit Bumrah expressed his satisfaction with the competitive series. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Harry Brook shone with centuries.

title: 114-year-old Shigeko Kagawa becomes Japan's oldest living person; shares longevity tip
content: The love of her family members serves as the foundation for Ms. Kagawa's happiness. She receives continuous joy through the combination of home support and her friendships with both former patients, and her existing social network. Local officials have honored her outstanding life achievements through official recognition for her dedicated service to the community

title: Uttarakhand floods: At least 10 Army jawans missing in Harshil
content: Tragedy struck Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district as cloudbursts triggered devastating flash floods in Harsil, leaving at least ten Army personnel missing. Rescue operations are underway, with the Air Force on standby to assist. The Kheer Ganga river overflowed, causing extensive damage in Dharali village, a key stop for Gangotri pilgrims.

title: KL Rahul's powerful post for two gutsy players goes viral
content: KL Rahul lauded Rishabh Pant and Chris Woakes for their unwavering dedication and courage while playing through pain for their respective countries. Pant battled a foot injury in the fourth Test, returning to bat with a bandage and scoring a half-century. Similarly, Woakes, despite a shoulder injury, emerged to bat in the final Test, showcasing remarkable grit and determination.

title: Delhi-Milan Air India flight aborted moments before take-off
content: Air India cancelled flight AI137 from Delhi to Milan on Tuesday due to a maintenance issue discovered in the Boeing 787 Dreamliner before takeoff. The airline is working to minimize passenger inconvenience by arranging alternative flights, hotel stays, and offering full refunds or free rescheduling. Recent weeks have seen Air India facing multiple flight disruptions due to technical problems.

title: Stephen Curry exposed by sister and god-sister: Damion Lee reveals shocking truth
content: Stephen Curry's playful nature is revealed through anecdotes shared by his sister, god-sister, and former teammate Damion Lee. Lee disclosed that Curry fuels his performance by reading hate comments on Twitter and responding to challenges. He even fulfilled a reporter's request to do airplane arms after making a three-pointer, showcasing his competitive spirit.

title: Porto legend Jorge Costa dies aged 53
content: Jorge Costa, the former captain of Porto, tragically passed away at the age of 53 due to a cardiac arrest at the club's training ground. A key figure in Porto's history, he won eight league titles and the Champions League in 2004.

title: 'Tejashwi must be watching': Tej Pratap launches 5-party coalition; invites RJD
content: Lalu Prasad's son, Tej Pratap Yadav, started a new political front. He allied with Pradeep Nishad's VVIP. Tej Pratap was expelled from RJD. He invited RJD and Congress to join him. Pradeep Nishad had differences with Mukesh Sahani. Tej Pratap plans to contest from Mahua. He dismissed Tejashwi contesting from Mahua. The new political development creates ripples in Bihar politics.

title: 'Here am I. Send me': How Trump is using the Bible to justify deportations
content: Legal scholars also raised red flags. The Establishment Clause of the US Constitution prohibits government endorsement of religion. While DHS has not officially responded to requests for clarification, civil liberties groups are reportedly preparing to challenge the campaign in court.

title: Forgiveness for some: Trump limits student loan relief except for ICE agents
content: In America, the Trump administration is changing student loan forgiveness. It favors ICE agents with bonuses and loan relief. Simultaneously, it restricts debt relief for teachers and nonprofit workers. Organisations aiding immigrants or transgender youth may be excluded. Critics call it hypocrisy. The administration is also dismantling the SAVE Plan. This shift impacts Indian students pursuing education in the US.

title: ‘Cultural misunderstanding 101’: Indian family’s havan in Texas invites firefighters
content: A Hindu housewarming ceremony in Texas took an unexpected turn when the Bedford fire department arrived, mistaking the traditional havan for a fire emergency. Viral footage shows firefighters inspecting the scene as the family performed the ritual.

title: Kerala schools plan to scrap backbenches: What this quiet reform could mean for classroom learning
content: Kerala is set to eliminate traditional backbenches in state-run schools, aiming to boost student confidence and equity. Inspired partly by the Malayalam film Sthanarthi Sreekuttan, the move challenges classroom hierarchies by promoting inclusive seating like U-shaped layouts. An expert panel will recommend alternatives as the state rethinks how physical space impacts learning outcomes and emotional wellbeing.

title: Voter list lapse: ECI suspends 4 Bengal officers over fake entries
content: The Election Commission of India took action against officials in West Bengal. Four officials got suspended for sharing elector roll database credentials. They shared it with unauthorized people. The action followed reports of wrongful additions to electoral rolls in Baruipur Purba. Disciplinary proceedings and FIRs are expected. This is due to potential criminal misconduct.

title: 15-year-old girl out for snacks shot dead in market by ‘boyfriend’
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, a 15-year-old girl was fatally shot by her 20-year-old boyfriend in a crowded market area. The accused, who is currently absconding, allegedly fired multiple rounds at the girl in front of a clinic, leading to her death.

title: Why the Delhi School Education Bill is facing sharp criticism: A closer look at the 15% clause
content: The Delhi School Education Fee Regulation Bill, 2025, proposes a three-tier oversight system to regulate private school fee hikes. Though billed as a transparency measure, it faces criticism over a clause allowing up to 15% annual fee hikes without external approval. Parents’ groups argue the provision empowers school managements disproportionately, risking further commercialisation in education.

title: Massive cloudburst in Uttarakhand: Entire village swept away; 4 dead, several missing
content: A cloudburst-triggered flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali village caused widespread devastation, sweeping away homes, shops, and roads. Rescue teams, including SDRF and Army personnel, are on-site conducting relief operations amid fears that laborers may be trapped. The Meteorological Department has issued warnings for continued heavy rainfall across Uttarakhand, particularly in hilly areas, until August 10.

title: Tougher checks for marriage-based Green Cards: US issues guidelines
content: USCIS has updated its policy manual to combat marriage fraud in family-based immigration, prompted by concerns over fraudulent applications and national security risks. The updated policy mandates comprehensive evidence of bona fide marriages and rigorous interviews. Individuals convicted of marriage fraud face imprisonment, fines, and deportation, reflecting stricter scrutiny and vetting procedures.

title: Catching up on the Big 12: Power Rankings, key players, must-see games

title: Training camp battles to watch for all 32 teams
content: training camps are off and running, and the 2025 season is right around the corner . players spend camp making their cases to be included on the final 53-man rosters at the end of august . coaches are seeking clarity on who starts and who will provide backup .

title: Biggest concern, what's left to play for and more: Post-trade-deadline guide for all 30 MLB teams
content: the 2025 trade deadline featured 92 veteran trade candidates on new teams . 92 prospects headed to new organizations seeking their big league opportunity . this is what we do with every edition of Stock Watch . there is never as much mystery in the outcomes as there is after a heavy period of roster movement .
